Description: Anmitsu is a dessert that has been popular for many decades. It is made of small cubes of agar jelly, a white translucent jelly made from red algae. The agar is dissolved with water to make the jelly.
Arare is a type of bite-sized cracker made from glutinous rice and flavored with soy sauce. The size and shapes are what distinguish arare from senbei.

Castella is a popular Portuguese sponge cake made of sugar, flour, eggs, and starch syrup. Now a specialty of Nagasaki, the cake was brought to Japan by Portuguese merchants in the 16th century. The name is derived from Portuguese Pão de Castela, meaning "bread from Castile"
Best I've ever had, would def go back!! Love the deep flavor.
As yummy and sweet as they were cute.

Daifuku, is a sweet consisting of a small round mochi stuffed with sweet filling, most commonly anko, sweetened red bean paste made from azuki beans. Daifuku comes in many varieties, the most common is white mochi filled with red bean.
Great combination of textures.
The white bean and strawberry was really unique and creamy.

Dango is a sweet made from mochiko, related to mochi. It is often served with green tea. Dango is eaten year-round, but the different varieties are traditionally eaten in given seasons. Three to five dango are often served on a skewer.
As fun to look as as they were to eat!  Super chewy.
The toasty and smooth flavors were incredible!
Mitarashi dango is a type of dango skewered onto sticks in groups of 3–5 and covered with a sweet soy sauce glaze. It is characterized by its glassy glaze and burnt fragrance.
This was such a fun treat! Warm and chewy.
Dorayaki is a red bean pancake which consists of two small pancake-like patties made from castella wrapped around a filling of sweet azuki bean paste.
A must try for chestnut lovers!
If you love fresh cream and pancakes, this is absolutely for you!
This was the best! Def worth the wait!
There is no better for matcha lovers, incredible deep flavors.
Such a fun addition to the other dorayaki I've eaten!

Imagawayaki is a Japanese dessert often found at Japanese festivals. It is made of batter in a special pan (similar to a waffle iron but without the honeycomb pattern), and filled with sweet azuki bean paste, although it is becoming increasingly popular to use a wider variety of fillings
Sooo smooth and creamy. Best eaten on a sunny day and empty stomach :)
Without question the best red bean snack I've had in Tokyo.
Kakigōri is a shaved ice dessert flavored with syrup and a sweetener, often condensed milk.
This shaved ice is huge!! I couldn't stop it was the perfect addition to a hot day.
It had really balanced flavors, not too sweet at all with the matcha.

Kaki no tane are a common snack in Japan. The two elements of kaki-pi are kaki-no-tane, small crescent-shaped fragments of senbei, and peanuts. They are often consumed with beer and are sometimes a bar snack. Kaki-pi has several different types of flavors, such as wasabi, pepper, amongst others.

Karintō is a traditional  snack food. Sweet and deep-fried, it is made primarily of flour, yeast, and brown sugar. It has a deep brown and pitted appearance, and takes the form of a bite-sized pillow or short cylinder.
Kuzumochi are mochi cakes made of kuzuko. It is local special dish in special wards of Tokyo. Those are traditionally served chilled, topped with kuromitsu and kinako.

Manjū is a popular traditional sweet. There are many varieties of manjū, but most have an outside made from flour, rice powder, kudzu and buckwheat and a filling of anko, usually made from boiled adzuki beans and sugar.
This is a smooth red bean manju.
The combo of red bean and cream is heavenly.
Sweet red bean manju in the cutest shapes!
Beautiful maple shaped red bean manju.
Yummy red bean manju that looks like a cute bunny!
A melonpan is a type of sweet bun. They are made from an enriched dough covered in a thin layer of crisp cookie dough.
Choose your ice cream flavor for a yummy melonpan ice cream sandwich.
A nice, less sweet alternative to normal melonpan
The cutest shaped melonpan!

Mizu manju is a dessert that is traditionally eaten during summer.It is a cake usually made from flour or rice powder stuffed with sweet red bean paste.The exterior of the mizu manju is made from kuzu starch, which makes the cake translucent and jelly-like appearance.
This .mizu manju is smooth and well balanced
Yummy and cute, very worth it!
Mizu yokan is a thick, jellied dessert made of red bean paste, agar, and sugar. It is usually sold in a block form, and eaten in slices.
The texture of the yokan and chestnut was incredible!
The toasty, warm flavor of kinako is really nice!
The texture is more chewy with coarser red beans.
It's in a little tube!
Mochi is rice cake made of a short-grain glutinous rice, and sometimes other ingredients such as water, sugar, and cornstarch. The rice is pounded into paste and molded into the desired shape.

Monaka is a sweet made of azuki bean jam filling sandwiched between two thin crisp wafers made from mochi. The jam can be made from azuki beans but also with sesame seed, chestnuts, or rice cake. Modern monaka can also be eaten filled with ice cream
Crunchy shell + sweet and smooth = amazing!
Great mix of flavours and textures!
It is huge and creamy!
Oshiruko is a traditional dessert. It is a sweet porridge of azuki beans boiled and crushed, served in a bowl with mochi.
A roll cake a type of sponge cake roll filled with whipped cream, jam, or icing.
Mildy bitter and super light cake that is to die for.
Sweet fresh strawberries make this roll cake exceptional!

Sakuramochi is a  sweet consisting of sweet pink-colored rice cake with a red bean paste center, and wrapped in a pickled cherry blossom leaf. Different regions of Japan have different styles of sakuramochi.
A little sweet, a little salty, this is a great traditional snack.

Senbei are a type of rice cracker. They come in various shapes, sizes, and flavors, usually savory but sometimes sweet. Senbei are often eaten with green tea as a casual snack and offered to visiting house guests as a courtesy refreshment.
Really wonderful crunch and saltiness!
Taiyaki is a fish-shaped cake. It imitates the shape of the tai (Japanese red snapper), which it is named after. The most common filling is red bean paste that is made from sweetened azuki beans.
There is nothing better than taiyaki + chocolate.
Amazing crunchy croissant style taiyaki, really different.
A custard filled taiyaki, it was so smooth!
Instagram ready taiyaki cones for sparkly ice cream!
It's not fried so it feels healthy.
A genius mix of lunch and dessert.

Warabimochi s a jelly-like confection made from bracken starch and covered or dipped in kinako. It differs from true mochi made from glutinous rice. It is popular in the summertime, there are many variations of warabimochi according to local taste.
Amazing texture and very filling.
This is the most plump and juicy warabi ever.
Anko is a sweet paste made of red beans. The paste is prepared by boiling the beans, then mashing or grinding them. It is a very popular and delicious flavor.
It's so precious and the red bean was great!
A must try for red bean lovers, great fresh dango!
The best bean paste and pancake known to Tokyo.
A wonderful traditional taiyaki that you'll think about all day.
There are many different textures, from smooth to a full bodied chunkiness.
Higashi, is a type of wagashi, which is dry and contains very little moisture, and thus keeps relatively longer than other kinds of wagashi.
Kinako, also known as roasted soybean flour, is a very tasty and popular flavour. In English, it is usually called "roasted soy flour", it is a little nutty and sweet.
So sweet and chewy with great taste.
It tastes like a festival in my mouth.
If I were to die tomorrow, I would eat this first.
Kinako shaved ice was not too sweet and perfectly yummy.
It tastes great!
Takes toastiness to a whole new level.
Kuromitsu is a sugar syrup, literally "black honey". It is similar to molasses, but thinner and milder. Try it on everything!
Black sugar + pancakes = my dream come true.
Redefines what sweet is.
Matcha is finely ground powder of specially grown and processed green tea leaves. It is slightly bitter but balances out sweet desserts beautifully. It is extremely poplar for all kinds of snacks!
Not sweet, but a pleasant bitterness.
This is a real game changer of a donut.
A real journey of matcha wildness!
The peak of luxury, wow such balance of creaminess and matcha.
What a fun matcha snack.
This is the smoothest matcha ice cream of all time.
This makes life worth living after all.
Namagashi are a type of wagashi, which is a general term for snacks used in the Japanese tea ceremony. Namagashi may contain fruit jellies, other gelatines such as Kanten or sweetened bean paste.

Yomogi is an herb made from the leaves of the Japanese Mugwort plant. In Japan, it's valued for its taste and as a natural green food color additive. For example, it's used to add green color variety of mochi known as kusa mochi, literally "grass mochi."
A very unique flavor that is very refreshing!
Yuzu is a citrus fruit and very refreshing. It is common in the summer.
Such a citrusy summer snack!
A beautiful clend of cream and crunch, sour and bitter.
So fun and citrusy! So refreshing.
This will give you life.
Tiny and cute, just great fresh flavor.
